intro: Baillonella djave, commonly known as the African sand dollar, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, spiny fruit that resembles a sand dollar. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Baillonella djave is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
